form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Carper (for himself and Ms. Collins) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to include automated fire sprinkler system retrofits as section 179 property and classify certain automated fire sprinkler system retrofits as 15-year property for purposes of depreciation.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Fire Sprinkler Incentive Act .

section.header: Automated fire sprinkler system retrofits treated as section 179 property

subsection.text: Subparagraph (B) of section 179(d)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

clause.text: automated fire sprinkler system retrofit property (as defined in section 168(i)(20) determined without regard to subparagraph (A)(ii) thereof), or
section 1245 property (as defined in section 1245(a)(3)), and

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Classification of certain automated fire sprinkler system retrofits

subsection.text: Subparagraph (E) of section 168(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking and at the end of clause (viii), by striking the period at the end of clause (ix) and inserting , and , and by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: any automated fire sprinkler system retrofit property.

subsection.text: Paragraph (3) of section 168(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: Any automated fire sprinkler system retrofit property.

subsection.text: The table contained in section 168(g)(3)(B) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting after the item relating to subparagraph (E)(ix) the following:

subsection.header: Definition of automated fire sprinkler system retrofit property

paragraph.header: Automated fire sprinkler system retrofit property
paragraph.text: The term automated fire sprinkler system retrofit property means any property which comprises a sprinkler system which—

subparagraph.text: is installed in a building or structure which—

clause.text: was placed in service before the date on which such sprinkler system is placed in service, and
has an occupiable story the floor of which is more than 75 feet above the lowest level of fire department vehicle access, and

subparagraph.text: is classified under one or more of the following:

clause.text: National Fire Protection Association 13, Installation of Sprinkler Systems.

National Fire Protection Association 13 D, Installation of Sprinkler Systems in One and Two Family Dwellings and Manufactured Homes or International Residential Code Section P2904, Dwelling Unit Fire Sprinkler Systems.
National Fire Protection Association 13 R, Installation of Sprinkler Systems in Residential Occupancies up to and Including Four Stories in Height.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act.
